text: The'Rosewood'grad is the first person to be cast in the firefighter - themed Shondaland series and rumored to be the lead. ABC's Grey's Anatomy spinoff has found its leading lady. Rosewood alum Jaina Lee Ortiz has booked what is believed to be the starring role in the firefighter - focused spinoff of the Shondaland medical drama, The Hollywood Reporter has confirmed. She is the first person to be cast. The new drama, picked up straight to series in May, centers on a group of heroic firefighters from the captain down the ranks in their personal and professional lives. The first episode will air as a planted episode of Grey's, which is set to return in the fall on ABC for its 14th season. The spinoff will feature an entirely new cast,
